title: Conductors - surface charge density on two spheres

content.question: Two metal spheres, Sphere <math alttext="1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>1</mn></math> with radius <math alttext="uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>R</mi></math> and Sphere <math alttext="2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn></math> with radius <math alttext="2 uppercase R" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mi>R</mi></math>, rest on insulating stands. Both spheres carry an excess charge of <math alttext="positive uppercase Q" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mo>+</mo><mi>Q</mi></mstyle></math>. The two spheres are briefly brought into contact, and are then separated. Which of the following correctly describes the resulting surface charge density, <math alttext="sigma sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>σ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="sigma sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>σ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>, on each sphere?

choices.label: <math alttext="sigma sub 1 is greater than 2 sigma sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>σ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><mn>2</mn><msub><mi>σ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="4 sigma sub 2 is greater than sigma sub 1, which is greater than sigma sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>4</mn><msub><mi>σ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>σ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>σ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>
<math alttext="sigma sub 1 equals sigma sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>σ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>σ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>
<math alttext="sigma sub 1 is less than sigma sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>σ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo><</mo><msub><mi>σ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="4 sigma sub 2 is greater than sigma sub 1, which is greater than sigma sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mn>4</mn><msub><mi>σ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>σ</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>></mo><msub><mi>σ</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>
